description: Blend of quin- +‎ quark, suggesting a fifth-level building-block of matter, as if quark were derived from Latin quartus (“fourth”).

entries.meaning: (physics) A hypothetical fundamental particle; a preon.
examples: For instance, quarks now are supposed to have their own elemental constituents: prequarks, maons, quinks, or rishons; so far there are ten kinds of them.
